intro: Streptocaulon divaricatum, commonly known as the variable streptocaulon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a distinctive branching pattern. Its flowers are small and white or greenish, arranged in umbels, and it produces a capsule fruit containing several seeds. Streptocaulon divaricatum is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas, showing adaptability to various soil types.
